page.title: 10Brightwell School
page.content: There has been a school in Brightwell for many years. In 1985 the School is housed in modern buildings. We have 120 children aged from 5 to 11 years of age - in four classes. The headteacher is Mr M.Lintern, the Deputy Head is Mr N. King who together teach the two classes of older children, and Mrs Humphrys and Mrs Dawson who teach the younger children. Mrs Whitten is the part time teacher. Children learn a wide variety of topics at school and we try to give them first hand experience whenever possible. Subjects include, maths, English, reading, science, religion, projects, P.E. and games, art and craft, history and geography and computer studies. Trips and residential visits to places of interest give children the chance to learn about themselves, as well as the world around them.
